comment.author: 27840099@N02
comment._content:
As a wildlife ranger for more than sixteen years over here in the UK and a one time squad leader in a Royal Marines Commando Reconnaissance Troop, I can totally connect with these wonderful images and I thank you for making them available for public view on Flickr.

Meanwhile I wish you all well and that everything goes exactly according to plan with any and all of Oregon's 150th anniversary celebrations. It must be a wonderful place to live and work.

comment.author: 58187415@N00
comment._content:
Happy one hundred fiftieth Oregon from Belgium . . .'-))
We used to live in Portland .

comment.author: 34586311@N05
comment._content: Hello to all of you across the ocean! I find I am enchanted with these images over and over again... I have the same experience with some of the Celilo Falls images we'll be releasing in a couple of weeks, as well as some of the logging photos of northwest Oregon taken by John Fletcher Ford.

comment._content:
69 yrs ago the government saw the way out of the economic crisis was to set up armies of unemployed and pay them. Then they entered the 2nd World War and had a post war boom.
What will they try this time?

comment.author: 40147761@N04
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called CCC, Civilian Conservation Corps Photos, and we'd love to have this added to the group!
